messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: "Potentially Hazardous Asteroids" are **asteroids, which are large rocks that fly through space,** that are close enough to pass within 7.5 million kilometres of our planet. NASA has created a map of 1,400 of these asteroids, but none of them are expected to be a danger in the next one hundred years. With the technology that is already available, NASA can follow these objects and predict a possible impact, and if this happens, two different plans could be used to protect the Earth.
Feedback received: Grade 1/10 - FAIL
